bin/histogram_data.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /**********************************************************doxygen*//** @file
00002  * @brief   Edge length histogram data collector.
00003  *
00004  * Prints out a list of every edge length present in given problem.  Used in
00005  * conjunction with a Python script for generating a histogram plot.
00006  *
00007  * @author  John LaRusic
00008  * @ingroup bin
00009  ****************************************************************************/
00010 #include "arrow.h"
00011 #include <getopt.h>
00012  
00013  /**
00014  *  @brief  Prints help/usage message.
00015  */
00016 void 
00017 print_help();
00018 
00019 /**
00020  *  @brief  Prints version message.
00021  */
00022 void 
00023 print_version();
00024 
00025 /**
00026  *  @brief  Prints usage message.
00027  */
00028 void 
00029 print_usage();
00030 
00031 /**
00032  *  @brief  Reads program arguments.
00033  */
00034 void 
00035 read_args(int argc, char *argv[]);
00036 
00037 /* Program options */
00038 char *program_name;             /**< Program name */
00039 char *input_file;               /**< Given input TSPLIB file */
00040 
00041 /****************************************************************************
00042  * Function implemenations
00043  ****************************************************************************/
00044 int 
00045 main(int argc, char *argv[])
00046 {   
00047     int stdout_id;
00048     
00049     /* Read program arguments */
00050     program_name = argv[0];
00051     read_args(argc, argv);
00052     
00053     /* Need to supress output from Concorde */
00054     arrow_util_redirect_stdout_to_file(ARROW_DEV_NULL, &stdout_id);
00055     
00056     /* Try and read the problem file and its info */
00057     arrow_problem problem;
00058     if(!arrow_problem_read(input_file, &problem))
00059     {
00060         arrow_print_error("Could not read input file.\n");
00061     }
00062     
00063     /* Restore output */
00064     arrow_util_restore_stdout(stdout_id);
00065     
00066     int i, j;
00067     for(i = 0; i < problem.size; i++)
00068     {
00069         for(j = i + 1; j < problem.size; j++)
00070         {
00071             printf("%d\n", problem.get_cost(&problem, i, j));
00072         }
00073     }
00074     
00075     /* Free up the structure */
00076     arrow_problem_destruct(&problem);
00077     
00078     return EXIT_SUCCESS;
00079 }
00080 
00081 void 
00082 print_help()
00083 {
00084     print_usage(program_name);
00085     printf("\n");
00086     printf("Compiles a list of the number of times a given edge length\n");
00087     printf("appears in the data set.  Used in conjunction with a Python\n");
00088     printf("script for generating a histogram plot.\n");
00089     printf("\n");
00090     printf("Options:\n");
00091     printf("  -h, --help                print this help, then exit\n");
00092     printf("  -V, --version             print version number, then exit\n");
00093     printf("\n");
00094     printf("Report bugs to <johnlr@gmail.com>.\n");
00095 }
00096 
00097 void 
00098 print_version()
00099 {
00100     printf("%s (Arrow histogram) 1.0\n", program_name);
00101     printf("(c) Copyright 2006-2008\n");
00102     printf("    John LaRusic, Eric Aubanel, and Abraham Punnen.\n");
00103     printf("\n");
00104     printf("This is free software.  You may redistribute copies of it\n");

00108     printf("\n");
00109     printf("Written by John LaRusic.\n");
00110 }
00111 
00112 void 
00113 print_usage()
00114 {
00115     printf("Usage: %s [options] tsplib_file\n", program_name);
00116 }
00117 
00118 void 
00119 read_args(int argc, char *argv[])
00120 {
00121     int opt_idx;
00122     char opt;
00123     char *short_options = "hVx";
00124     struct option long_options[] =
00125     {
00126         {"help", no_argument, 0, 'h'},
00127         {"version", no_argument, 0, 'V'}
00128     };
00129 
00130     while(1)
00131     {
00132         opt = getopt_long(argc, argv, short_options, long_options, &opt_idx);
00133         if(opt == -1) break;
00134         
00135         switch (opt)
00136         {
00137             case 'h':
00138                 print_help(argv[0]);
00139                 exit(EXIT_SUCCESS);
00140                 break;
00141             case 'V':
00142                 print_version(argv[0]);
00143                 exit(EXIT_SUCCESS);
00144                 break;
00145             default:
00146                 printf("Option: %c\n", opt);
00147                 print_usage(argv[0]);
00148                 exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00149         }
00150     }
00151     
00152     /* Read the file name to process */
00153     if(optind == argc)
00154     {
00155         arrow_print_error("No problem file specified.\n");
00156         print_usage(argv[0]);
00157         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00158     }
00159     else if(optind < argc - 1)
00160     {
00161         arrow_print_error("Multiple input files specified.\n");
00162         print_usage(argv[0]);
00163         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00164     }
00165     input_file = argv[optind];    
00166 }
